intro: Sannantha, commonly known as the yellow bell or golden bell, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Sannantha is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Its flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as birds and insects.
